info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 4:50PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WESTERN UNION AND EAST CENTRAL COLFAX COUNTIES THROUGH 515 PM MDT... At 450 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles north of Farley, or 22 miles southwest of Des Moines, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of western Union and east central Colfax Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
